page.title: 09Closure of buildings
page.content: In Butterton, the village primary school was closed in 1979 but the building has now become the village hall. A Bingo session is now held there every other Monday evening and a doctor's surgery is held there every day. During the annual Butterton Gala the village hall is used for fund raising activities and the disco. Another building that has been closed is the chapel. It is now a carpenter's workshop but the owner wants to change it into a holiday cottage. In Onecote, the primary school was closed in 1984 and the villagers would now like to turn it into a village hall. The Post Office in Onecote has also recently been closed due to the ill health of the former Post mistress.
